meanings.definition: The worship of idols or excessive admiration for someone or something.
meanings.sent1: In some cultures, idolatry involves bowing down to statues.
meanings.sent2: Her idolatry of the famous singer was evident in the way she collected all his albums.
meanings.sent3: John's idolatry of his favorite sports team reached new heights when he painted his room in their colors.
meanings.sent4: The idolatry of wealth can blind people to the true value of relationships.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the idolatry of power through the corrupt politician's actions.

meanings.sent1: Idolatry was common in ancient civilizations where people believed in multiple gods.
meanings.sent2: The temple was a place of idolatry where offerings were made to the gods.
meanings.sent3: Sarah jokingly accused her friend of idolatry for always carrying around her lucky charm.
meanings.sent4: The idolatry of nature was evident in the rituals performed by the tribe to appease the spirits.
meanings.sent5: The idolatry of celebrities can sometimes overshadow more important issues in society.
